page.title: 13Church School in Soham
page.content: {Soham Church of England Junior {School}is a controlled school, which means that it is controlled by the Education Authority. As far as we know it was opened in 1856 as a school for girls. It became a mixed school in september 1958.The original part of the school was the present hall,which was divided by curtains into three classes,the School House and the head_ teacher's office. The present School has those buildings plus two other blocks at the main School site.In addition the school uses the old infant School as an annexe.This is situated approximately one hundred metres further along Clay Street. In February{1863}there were{184 pupils and in June{1985}there are{209.
